    • Method Detail

      • getLocalHtmlUrlFromRemoteUrl

        public static java.lang.String getLocalHtmlUrlFromRemoteUrl(java.io.File localCacheDirectory,
                                            java.lang.String remoteZipUrl)
        Takes a remote url pointing to zip file assets and then downloads them into a local directory.

        The local content folder will be created one level under localCacheDirectory and the assets from remoteZipUrl will be unzipped into that location. Finally, this method will return the local URL pointing to the assets using the "file://" protocol. We clear the cache directory before any downloads in case orphaned IAMs exist on the system. In case of error, any files created will be deleted. This includes any files downloaded or unzipped.

        Parameters:
        localCacheDirectory - the root directory path where the assets will be downloaded
        remoteZipUrl - the URL for the assets zip
        Returns:
        the local web content directory on the file system. Returns null if the download fails.

      • clearEntireHtmlInAppMessageCache

        public static void clearEntireHtmlInAppMessageCache(java.io.File localCacheDirectory)
        Clears the folder containing all the HTML In-App Messages in the local storage. This includes any downloaded zip files and unpacked zip files. Adapted from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/18200811/android-clear-cache-programmatically
        Parameters:
        localCacheDirectory - the local cache directory, NOT the IAM cache. The IAM cache path will be constructed from the local cache directory.

      • clearInAppMessageLocalAssets

        public static void clearInAppMessageLocalAssets(IInAppMessageHtml inAppMessage)
        Parameters:
        inAppMessage - the IInAppMessageHtml to have its assets cleared from the local cache
